conclusion: Analyze the velocity-time graphs of cars A and B.
At t=30s, the cars are side by side, implying their positions are equal.
Identify the points on the graph where the cars are side by side at t=30s.
Since cars are side by side at t=30s, their initial positions are equal at that time.
At t=10s, the cars are also side by side as their initial positions are equal.
At t=10s, Car A is at the same position as Car B.
At t=30s, Car A is moving faster than Car B as its velocity is greater.
At t=30s, Car A is ahead of Car B.
Conclude that at t=10s, Car A is not ahead of Car B, but at t=30s, Car A is ahead.
At t=10s, Car A is not ahead of Car B; at t=30s, Car A is ahead of Car B.
